content: piece of waste yarn to your larger needle 31 stitches whilst the sleeve will be worked flat and not in the round you may find it more comfortable to use a long circular needle with a flexible cable as you start the sleeve with rs facing and starting at the centre of the cast on edge at the base of the armhole the underarm or armpit area pick up and knit 2 stitches then knit the 31 stitches already on your needles then finally pick up and knit 2 stitches from the other half of the base of the armhole 35 stitches above and below row 1 ws purl all stitches wee ashley cardyand wee morrie bonnet row 2 rs knit all stitches knit and photographed by kelly van niekerk continue alternating sleeve row 1 & 2 until the sleeve measures approximately 9 5cmfrom the underarm or armpit area end having just worked a ws/purl row part i sleeve edging worked flat change to smaller needle below clockwise from bottom right row 1 rs knit all stitches wee ashley cardyand wee morrie bonnet knit and photographed by instagram users row 2 ws k15 p2 k2 p2 k14 onecraftymumma bonnycrafts emmajane1626 continue alternating sleeve edging row 1 & 2 until top right facebook user k harold the sleeve edging measures approximately 1 5-2cm loosely cast off repeat parts h & i for second sleeve part j finishing sew in all ends if sleeves were knit flat then seam the arms closed securely sew buttons to the garter stitch button band corresponding with the buttonholes wash in a gentle wool wash then lay flat and in shape to dry page 5 wee ashley designed by kelly van niekerk wee ashley ©2017 kelly van niekerkall rights reserved #weeashleycardy i give my blessing for you to knit and sell as many items using this pattern as you wish need pattern support/assistance visit www ravelry com/groups/pekapekadesign-studio social media instagram -@pekapekapatterns facebook pekapekadesignstudio ravelry -gurnard
